length for the step fasten_off and 11 12 use the tails to sew the leaves onto your tapestry © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 9 i attached my leaves with a tapestry needle with just a few stitches going back and forth through the piece i like for my leaves to look more 3 dimensional so i chose not to use too many stitches which could result in flattening out the leaves © 2025 earth hand & fiber page 10 finishing mounting to a dowel or branch there are several methods for mounting a tapestry to a dowel but i find the easiest method is to sew it on using a tapestry needle using the long yarn reserved after fastening off your tapestry thread the end of your yarn into a tapestry needle if you did not reserve any yarn cut a piece of yarn approximately 5 times the length of your dowel and join one end of your yarn to the upper right corner of your piece thread the other end of your yarn into your tapestry needle loop your yarn around the dowel and insert your needle through the first chain space of your border pulling the yarn all the way through loop the yarn around the dowel again and insert into the next chain space repeat this process across your piece then fasten_off to secure the yarn video tutorial https //youtube com/shorts/7zmvmqijffs crochet a hanger screw eye pin i like to add screw eye pins to my dowel for attaching the yarn hanger to but this is optional to use the screw pins simply screw 2 pins by hand directly into the top of the dowel one on each end to crochet the hanger make a chain of your desired length then attach each end to your screw pins note that your chain will stretch some when hung so you will want it to be little tight if you choose not to use screw pins you may attach each end of your chain directly to the ends of your dowel © 2025
